intro: Cestichis benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet cestichis, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a critically endangered species.
